title: No longer offers onsite appointments
body: This surgery no longer pre-booked appointments. Doctor asseses patients of the phone. This is ridiculous service.

title: Great doctors
body: Very good doctors who are thorough and willing to take the time out and listen. Spoke to two different doctors at the surgery recently and both have been very very good. Happy with the service received from them, however the phone lines and the appointment system is absolutely diabolical.

title: Horrendous
body: My 69 year old grandad has ended up calling the emergency 999, 111 and Tesco pharmacy all because he got that scared he was going to become seriously unwell due not getting his medication. He spent three full days ringing and ringing with no answer. Thought out the pandemic this doctors service has been nothing short of negligence, from “we can call you between 8-6 with no set time,” to full on refusing to find appointments.

title: Would not recommend
body: I can't remember the last time I went to the doctors tbh because anytime I call even at 8am like they tell me too I can never get a appointment as I'm on hold for about a hour and I get cut off at least 4 times while waiting then you get that smug person to answer the phone knowing you have been on the line all that time and says sorry we don't have no more appointments for today you will have to give us a call back tomorrow morning around 8am so I do it again and again until finally you just give up and just decide you can try get yourself better or find a new doctor

title: jump through hoops to get appointment, then only…
body: Just try phoning, or any other way, to get an appointment at King Street, its almost impossible. The receptionists are rude and know more than the doctors, when you ask their name as reference they refuse to give. Most people only phone doctors if they are ill, by the time you get an appointment here you will either be better or dead. My family have been with this practice for over 70 years but we are going to transfer to another one that actually cares about its patients, and has respect for them.

title: Excellent communications between all staff and…
body: You’re never made to feel any problem is too small , receptionists are always very helpful .every g.p I have encountered is always caring and and you never feel rushed . I hold this surgery in the highest regard

title: Bizzare
body: Ive been told to wait in car and they will call me in an hour, they called after 3, didnt even see my daughter, but send atibiotic prescription straight to pharmacy, and that was for a FOUR YEAR OLD child. You better off googling your symptoms. Staff is lazy, incompetent and "care" is non existant there.

title: Brilliant practice!
body: I visited my doctors last week and from the reception staff to the doctors I can honestly say that I couldn’t fault them. I had a telephone consultation originally and I was then asked to come in for a face to face with my doctor. I was welcomed by the receptionist who was more then happy to help with an enquiry I had and marked me in. I then only had to wait 5 or so minutes to see the doctor and that’s because I came a little early so I had been seen at my time on the dot. The doctor was ever so polite and professional and made me feel comfortable throughout my appointment. I genuinely it such a great practice and have always had pleasant visits and would most definitely recommend this surgery to my friends, my family are already here.

title: An Example of a good medical practise during…
body: Called the surgery at around 11.00 spoke to a receptionist gathered my information and arranged for me to receive a phone call from my GP .I was soon called and booked in for an appointment at 12.00 . I call that good service in these difficult times .

title: Trying to get an appointment is a joke
body: Good luck if you work for a living you won’t get an appointment and if you do it will be any time in the am or pm treatment for a simple water infection too hours to get hold of anyone for an appointment then it was telephone and then it was at 6:30 pm when the local pharmacy has closed. Try to ring for an appointment your waiting 30-40 people in the queue. What’s changed in the last 18 months when you could ring up and get an appointment the same day using COVID as an excuse to not see patients or deal with their health issues is shocking your referred to 111 or a&e told not to ring the dr. Try to get anything sorted that routine and your wait is horrendous over 4 weeks for a medication to be prescribed by the gp after a specialist  from the hospital wrote to them to add it on. Seriously how is this acceptable care please do better

title: Poor service
body: My father in law was awaiting for a bed to come available at Wythenshawe for urgent treatment on the 19-6-2021 at 17.00 a bed came available but to my annoyance the ambulances stop at 17.00 so they had to hire a private ambulance, this has still not turned up at 22.00 hours absolutely disgusting he has now lost his place no wonder the NHS is a mess poor management

title: An embarrassment to the NHS
body:
I took my daughter for a plaster fitting in the walk in centre at Whitegate Drive Health Centre. 
The care from the plaster technician  and the nurse that we saw initially was excellent. 
However I found the rudeness of other staff totally unacceptable.  I was unable to go in with my daughter so waited in another area. Imagine my surprise when after my wait I was told "you  can collect 'er now" ie no confirmation of my daughter's name.  When I challenged this I was told that this particular person hadn't been seeing to her so therefore did not know her name.  I mentioned my concerns to the person at the triage point who told me that he was "just the bouncer" I have worked for the NHS for over 30 years as a registered nurse and find this sort of attitude totally unacceptable and if any of the staff behaved towards patients in this way disciplinary measures would be put in place.  I was absolutely horrified.

readBy.name: Blackpool Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Major problems
body:
1. 
The doctors obviously do a good job when you get them face to face. But getting to the point is extremely difficult or even a phone call. My little girl had a chest infection and they wouldn’t see her with out a covid test - that was Wednesday, did test but came back Saturday ( doctors now shut) .. ended up on the weekend s having to call 111 as the infection had now caused her ears to have a infection, because of excessive coughing, if they had just seen her or even acknowledged she was poorly .. she wouldn’t have had to go through the pain, rolling around, crying in agony- she’s only 3. But the Doctor just wouldn't see her … she had no symptoms for covid. 

2.
On a separate note, trying to even physically get through to the doctors is astonishing.. you could be waiting over an hour just to get through to the reception to be told, no appointments for 4 weeks. 

3. 
I also find their facebook post quite passively aggressive..  
 Eg.. about being kind and understanding. Which is perfectly acceptable - obviously- 
but they are also referring to a circumstance  that happened in the day - (they don’t name)  they just say that someone’s been doing that day - they start with …. We would just like to remind people ….. 
but if that person ( whatever the did) was having a mental breakdown over
Their frustration getting through to doctors etc… ( which it was) .. how is that okay to put that on Facebook. Wouldn’t just reminded people that we must come together and support each other in hard times…. Instead of the singling out. 

4. 
The amount of people that came for an appointment and was turned away (whilst I was waiting for me appointment in the waiting area) was approx 3 people - in the space of 10 minutes.. with the receptionist saying they had the wrong time… that cannot be right, there is obviously something going wrong  there. These people was really upset, as some couldn’t come back.

title: High Quality Intensive Care
body:
Our daughter was admitted to Queens Square m.i.t.u at the start of Aug 2020 with nmda encephalitis. We'd never heard of this illness. She was 16 years old at the time of admission. She was intubated and sedated the following day and there began a 10 month journey we could've never imagined. A team of consultants, doctors, anaesthetist, nurse and family support dr met us on arrival and very clearly and considerately explained the diagnosis and treatment plan. We were left in no doubt that our daughters situation was very serious, she was extremely ill, and would be sedated for weeks but more likely months. This devastating news was delivered to us with with great care and consideration and all our questions were answered as much as possible. We then donned ppe and was allowed to sit with our daughter at the bedside for a limited time due to covid restrictions. Our heads were spinning with worry, it was massively stressful and as we were ending this visit an icu nurse came up to us and said something very important, she said, 'while your daughter is here with us, we will look after her like she is our little sister, we promise'. Our daughter was sedated for almost 3 months. There were many complications during this time, infections, blood clots, collapsed lung and an op to remove a faulty gland. We were only allowed a short bedside visit (fully ppe) once a week due to covid restrictions. Our daughters skin was always moisturised, her mouthcare was excellent, her hair was always washed (and styled) and she was always very clean and fresh. The nurses were absolute in their commitment and promise to us and cared for her with great dedication. They would always talk to her even though she was sedated and would sit and hold her hand when we couldn't. This level of care never dipped during all the time at mitu and as the weeks went by it reassured us and enabled us to eventually get some sleep at night. We were encouraged to call any time of the day or night and the nurse would always update us and hold the phone by her ear so we could talk and say goodnight. We were called daily by the consultant or doctor regarding treatments and progress updates and nothing was ever done without us being informed. After 1st and 2nd line immuno therapies, an operation and just over 11 weeks they were finally able to wake our daughter. Then followed 7 more months of recovery and rehabilitation within Queens Square. There are no words to express our gratitude to the consultants, doctors and especially the fantastic team of nurses in mitu who cared so brilliantly and tirelessly for our daughter in such a high pressure environment. You are all true professionals and a credit to the hospital and the n h s. 
Our daughter walked out of Queens Square at the end of May after an intensive recovery and rehabilitation programme. It feels like a miracle. There is still a way to go but now as an outpatient.
A massive thankyou to everyone in mitu from the bottom of our hearts.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Dangerous
body: The latest experience was calling for my son (age 3) having shortness of breath. Over the phone they classified it minor and   and sent us a link to complete a questionnaire so some doctor would call us at some point. We called 111, after they heard the situation, they sent ambulance immediatelly. The ambulance admitted us to hospital where they kept my son for almost a day. No comments.

title: After many years with them it’s now hit rock…
body: Tell everyone to avoid. Awful service. Never answer the phone. Closed the e consult service so can’t use that. Not at all helpful. One minute they can do something the next time they decide they can’t. Just seen as a nuisance whenever I phone. Looking to move ASAP. Do not join this surgery unless you want to me spoken to badly. Poor mental health services, awful support, just poor all round. Which is sad for me to say after 10 years being with them.

title: Unempathetic Receptionist
body: My mother in law left her GP practice in tears due to the way she was spoken to by a receptionist here. She got the day wrong for her appointment. She is elderly and often gets confused due to her dementia, there was no need to make a vulnerable person feel bad just because they made a mistake on an appointment date!

title: Great practice
body: Thank you so much for the difference you make in the lives of your patients! You take the time to listen and to make your patients feel valued and respected, treating others as you would want to be treated.

title: Waited 6 hours for a call, 15 hours later still…
body:
They wonder why our A&E services are always busy with people that can seem attention from their GP! 

Phoned 111 as my child had been suffering with diarrhea for 7 days with no improvement. After saying she was experiencing belly pains I thought medical attention was needed. 

A lovely girl handled my call, (her customer service skills were great) once she had finished  asking me all the questions needed she said that my little girl needed to see a doctor within 6 hours and that a doctor would ring me back within the 6 hours, well its 15 hours and I've had no call. I tired ringing 111 back, but of course the pre recorded message of *if you are waiting for a nurse or a doctor to ring you back please be bear with us as we are extremely busy* kind of makes you feel back for pestering them. 

I know Covid is a big thing and I know that the NHS has been over run with people that are suffering from it. But people/ young children are ill with other things, it's not right that medical attention is taken away from these people. 

I hate to moan about this service, but I feel so let down right now.

title: Great Patient Care
body:
Following my recent experience at Wilson Street Surgery, I would like to record my views as follows:
From my initial phone call to the Appointments Desk, through to a phone consultation with an Advanced Care Practitioner on the same day and subsequently an “in person” consultation with a Doctor at the Surgery, I was treated with politeness, respect and empathy by all staff.
The doctor took the time to explain my symptoms, their possible causes and suggested treatment at all stages of the consultation.
This has been a positive and reassuring experience.
Thank you

title: Excellent
body: Visited A&E with spin problems and received excellent care. Thorough investigation into my problems and all the staff were friendly and professional. I was in for over half a day and check on at all times and made comfortable. It was also nice to see the elderly patients who were on the ward being treated with care and dignity. Would highly recommend. Thank you everyone.

title: Unacceptable service
body: We have been waiting for more than 3.5 hours to be seen. We had a 1-year old with a temperature of 39.5oC. I find this completely unacceptable. While waiting we were not given any updates on how long we would need to wait for and staff clearly avoided me when I tried to ask for more information. I felt ignored. I am extremely disappointed by the service and I will try to avoid coming here again at all costs. This is unacceptable service for a country like the UK.

readBy.name: Mid Essex Hospital Services NHS Trust

title: No contact email address?
body: I find it staggering that this GP service does not provide an email contact option, meaning that they're still expecting people to attend in person for any non urgent enquiries! Tried calling, and after almost 40mins held in the queue was told that I would need to send my enquiry in by post. That's a paper letter (hand written or printed) with a stamp and a postman involved: communication efficiency and patient service at its worst!

title: Staff very rude, not helping
body: We are all family members registered with this surgery. The reception staff is very rude. Never wants to help, don't answer the queries and trying to cut the phone. Their I.T system not working and we can not get Vaccination certificate to travel because NHS system cannot connect to their system. Asked them several times and emailed them but there staff have no idea. What is NHS app all about. What covid vaccination digital ID.

title: Amazing ICU Staff
body: I was a 49 year old father of four at the time and was admitted under an emergency (Heart attack, heart failure and bleed on brain) and was in ICU for 3 weeks with little hope for a recovery. And then thanks to these totally amazing people, I started to respond and was slowly taken off all  support and breathed for myself and quickly was back on my feet. Due to covid I was not permitted to see my family members but these selfless staff, face timed my family regularly, on their own phones you are all stars. Xxx Than you to ICU for your caring and personal attention that you give me and my family. I will never forget you all xxx

readBy.name: Kettering General Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: The NHS at its finest
body: Every step of the process was handled with the utmost care, compassion and professionalism. From receiving the diagnosis, through the operation itself and the follow-up recovery care, everyone I came in contact with was excellent. I could have gone private, but having met the NHS consultant I knew I wanted him to perform the operation and have absolutely no regrets.

title: Great, compassionate, professional care
body: Attended for routine screening checks. The staff explained when they ran into difficulties, ensured I was comfortable, informed throughout and went out of their way to ensure a successful outcome. The additional time required and the need for other staff to come and assist were no problem. All were entirely professional, cheerful and encouraging clearly explaining what was happening. Great care

title: excellent service
body: Just to say a huge thankyou to the team working in the gynae OPD that I have recently had to visit on an urgent appointment.  Their systems were extremely safe, all the team were professional and very supportive,I really wanted to say how much I appreciated your communications both clinical and admin on the day, when a patient is anxious about the appointment, being kept updated on what's happening and to have everything explained in such a meaningful way, really does make a difference. You all went over and above and for all of this I am truly grateful. You are all a credit to the NHS.

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Excellent Nurses
body:
I have been attending the surgery almost daily for the last few weeks for wound packing/dressing following surgery. 
All of the nurses have been lovely, caring and very personable. They have done a great job of looking after my wound and have been very helpful offering advice to help me look after it myself too.
They are an asset to the practice and I’m very grateful to have been under their care. 
Thank you all very much.

title: Efficient and Helpful
body: I don't live locally but I must say I am really thankful to the team. The staff at reception was so helpful and my dad got to see the GP immediately after I raised concerns. Thank you so much for your quick response. Really really grateful

title: Fantastic team
body: After twisting my ankle i saw the fracture team, they where fantastic and quick with great care, i had a quick X-ray and to be found it was a bad sprain much to my embarrassment on wasting their time, they gave the best advice and i am hobbling much better with my stick, thank you for your time and care, i was extremely happy with the care they provided especially during covid. I will be sure to bring the stick back along with some treats for you all

readBy.name: Mid Essex Hospital Services NHS Trust

title: Really bad treatment
body: I’m new to this practice. I realized I couldn’t access online repeat prescriptions, I checked online and it said to call them. I call them, the automatic message on the phone was if this is administrative contact us online, however as I cannot access online I stay on the phone. When I finally get through I tell them woman, and she hung up on me before I got a chance to explain that I don’t have access online, she just heard repeat prescription and hung up. That is so rude, and now I cannot reach them.

title: Efficient and caring!
body: Thanks to all in the Urology Department at RCHT for the efficient and compassionate care received recently. The surgeon, the anaesthetist and the nursing staff in the recovery and Eden wards all deserve the highest praise particularly at this stressful time coping with the increased workload resulting from the Covid outbreak.

title: Great hospital
body: Was taken to A & E by ambulance after falling down stairs, couldn’t have had better treatment.  Doctors and nurses very caring.  Admitted to Ward A3 where I stayed for 10 days and the staff were excellent.  Can’t thank them enough.

title: Excellent reception lady !
body: I was instructed to take her hearing aids to the top floor ! Then hand 🤚 the envelope over ! The lady said “ I think we can do it now “ she then took it away , sorted it out proper !! My mum was so happy 😁! Well done ! Thanks !

title: Excellent organisation and friendly staff
body: I felt cared for and informed about the procedure. It is good that each member of staff seems to specialise in a particular aspect and all do their jobs well.

title: Terrible attitude
body: My father in law who is 85 and is not very well had fallen over and bruised his shoulder. He was having discomfort when sitting and popped in to the Doctors to see if someone could look at his shoulder. The surgery was was completely empty apart from the receptionist. He explained his problem and and she went in to the back and returned later with the suggestion that he goes to A&E. My father in law is clinically and extremely vulnerable, which the surgery didn’t code him for and served in the army and served the community as a policeman for many years. To suggest he visits A&E was terrible, they couldn’t even be bothered just to get a nurse or a doctor to look at him, a total lack of care.

title: Excellent Care and Treatment
body:
Arrived by Ambulance at 1100 after first receiving a thorough examination at home by two great paramedic guys .  First Doctor checking me soon after arrival. Double vision Bad Headaches AF and more. Spent the day having various tests and checks including CT Scan,  much Vision testing. Still unsure so Eye clinic at 1700 confirmed they knew the problem. discharged at 1900 with medication and a  return for a biopsy in 6 weeks. I would like to thank all concerned for the very caring and professional manner I had that day particularly the stroke team who thought I might have a stroke coming on, they were very thorough. Well looked after by the Doctors and Nursing staff in between visits for the various  tests. 
I cannot sing your praises high enough God Bless you all.

title: Amazing 'all inclusive'
body: As above 'Amazing all Inclusive' that's what the name band on my wrist gave me, Health Care, food, drink, and the view was great to. Spent 24 hours in hospital for incision and drainage of an abscess between first 4b and then 4a ward. All the staff are absolutely Fantastic, Caring, Smiling and Professional these are people who literally save lives everyday, we can never pay them enough because they are priceless. Nurses, Cleaners, Doctors, Anaesthetists, Cooks, Porter , Surgeons, Receptionist, and the lady in the shop who scanned 33 bars of chocolate for the above, good job I was only there for one day really everyone would need the dentist. I would like to Thank you so much for what you did for me, I wanted to stay longer that food was amazing, anyway i would just like to say, what ever your Religion or Belief may they Bless you in the same way you Blessed me. Take Care Ian x

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Great hospital
body: Midwifes in my birth and surgeons in theatre afterwards were amazing they made my experience/memories so special and took such good care of me. Experience on maternity ward could of been nicer found myself in tears most days - think I was treated differently for being a young mum. Other then that great hospital.

title: Disappointed
body: Very poor service from AE like usual always waiting time too much i do understand with Covid is difficult but only in this hospital is difficult..And very difficult security guys they rude not helping people (looks like they are owner of hospital)

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

title: Don't bother calling ward for update, ringer…
body: If you try calling C8 via the switchboard or on the direct ward line chances are that your call will never be answered. C8 like many of the other wards switch the phone ringer off. Totally disgusting specially since we cannot visit our relatives during COVID restrictions.  Some patients are not able to communicate with relatives via mobile phone. Imagine if we ignored the hospital calling to arrange discharge for patients back home. We gave  up after three day's and dozens of calls.

title: Where has all the care gone
body: Nobody answers phone , nobody answers your questions , nobody cares ,  nobody looks your in the eye , the patients in ward 43 are at risk

title: Amazing care
body: I had my little boy just under two weeks ago, and would really like the two midwives to be noticed as they were both absolutely amazing and delivered my baby boy safely! A huge huge Thankyou to them both! I am forever going to grateful for especially the second midwife I had she was absolutely incredible as is a credit to your service!

title: Irresponsible Practice
body: I caught Covid-19 while I was in Queens Hospital but I didn’t know it and I was discharged with it.  I passed it on to my husband who became very ill and he is over 80.  I had no contact with anyone else so it didn’t spread any further which was very fortunate but with no thanks to Queens.  It could have gone around the family and beyond .

readBy.name: Barking, Havering and Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Terrible service
body: Was advised by minor injuries to visit my GP for a tetanus shot and to get a series of wounds examined and dressed by the doctor. The doctor only looked at one set of injuries, not the badly infected one and refused to give me my tetanus shot as I had one 16 years earlier. This goes against PHE and Green Book advise. When I phoned back to question this, I was on hold for 40 minutes with the phone ringing for the last 20, but as it ticked past 1pm into their lunch break, the phone was left ringing for the next hour. Resorted to 111 who told me that I had received all the wrong treatment and I should report IMMEDIATELY to A&E where I was told again that I had received sub standard care at the surgery and it went against all medical advise. Absolutely appalling!

title: Good service
body: Way easier and much more convenient than waiting for an appointment at the hospital hardly any waiting list. Would book again via this.

title: Great service no delay
body:
My GP sent me to get checked after I had concerning symptoms and from the minute I arrived until I left everything was prompt, well organised and timely. No delays whatsoever. 
On arrival I was seen by the nurse, had an ECG and then sent for blood tests, after a short wait I was seen by the Doctor, who was informative and reassuring explaining what he could in detail, accompanied me for an x-ray, results were provided by the the time I had arrived back in the consultation room and then explained to me next steps and advice. 
The only minor negative was the staff member who took my blood could have been a little more welcoming and friendly. But overall a great service and no delays. Thank you

title: Outstanding practice
body:
The quality of care and professionalism is excellent throughout the whole team in Valley Road Surgery. I feel particularly thankful for the expertise and availability of the doctors and feel the use of technology has further enhanced our contact with the surgery without ever compromising on the much valued personal touch. As a patient I feel there is a genuine health partnership approach being encouraged by the practice.  During the pandemic the medical support experienced by our family has been exceptional with speedy referrals made by the GP and successful treatment started for cancer at King's as soon as they were able to do so.
I would like to say a special thank you for all your hard work on a daily basis during these challenging times to an exceptional Valley Road Surgery team.

title: Amazing Labour Ward
body:
Absolutely amazing care during labour. My midwife was so supportive and my anaesthetist cheered me up and made me laugh. I took and epidural for the pain but needed to have a forceps delivery as baby rotated and got stuck. 

The after care was really good and I received plenty of help from the staff on the labour ward. This really helped as my partner couldn’t stay after the birth due to coronavirus restrictions. I would highly recommend.

author: Mind Riot
title: My continued Mental Health struggle
body:
This is a follow on story from my last story, as nothing has changed, if anything much has gotten worse.  
I have been struggling with depression, anxiety and bouts of mania for the last 6 years that have been documented and to a far lesser degree in the years prior to that. In the last 2 years, I have been told by CPN's that, I am under 30, I am very articulate, I am well-read. I have had a CPN tell me on the phone whilst experience symptoms of psychotic depression suggest that I go for a bath and light candles at an appointment that was supposed to be a 2nd opinion appointment but was actually the staff member again. It was also suggested to my girlfriend that I need to take responsibility and contact Samaritans and that I shouldn't be putting her through all this, like I choose to be the way I am.  
I then eventually received a legitimate 2nd opinion appointment, which I didn't feel I could attend as it was via webcam and I have somewhat of an anxiety to going on camera and being recorded. I asked for alternatives and was told no. After some time I got a 2nd opinion appointment and finally got to see another psychiatrist, for them just to uphold word for word what the previous had said. Them seeming to gloss over my suicide attempt, my mania and just pinned it all on anxiety when I disagreed and asked for more than just CBT which is all I've been offered for 4 years, they didn't offer any further help, much as they have for the last 4-5 years. I have been told I am too clever to be bipolar, which really offends me, having had family members who had it who were extremely clever.  
I was told over the phone when I called to speak to the on-duty CPN about my treatment by the mental health team that they couldn't do anything and couldn't change what had been said by the psychiatrists. They also said they weren't able to diagnose anything, however in the same phone call told me that it isn't bipolar disorder. I mean what is it? They can or can't diagnose it?  
I was checked by the psychiatrist at my 2nd opinion appointment as I expressed that I was sick of the treatment I felt I had been receiving from them, they then ended the appointment, and refused to talk to my partner in regards to my deteriorating mental health. I was told by the health and social care partnership to phone and tell them what I need and insist on help but was told they can't do a thing.  
I have been made to feel that because I may or not be intelligent, and that I can sometimes articulate myself that I am somehow not able to be bipolar or anything other than depressed and anxious, I find this to be insulting to anyone that has a diagnosis of the illness and other people that are on the spectrum. The fact this is a viewpoint I've seen perpetuated by a fair few of the professionals I have spoken to is really rather distressing. They can tell me these last few years what my diagnosis isn't, but have no clue as to what it is, I'd ask that they stop focusing on what is not and start focusing on what is then.  
I have complained by other means, but I am also writing this as I hope local government and others can see this as I am truly at the end of my rope and am fighting tooth and nail to see the good in life, but this is far more distressing trying to get help than I ever thought it could be. If a patient like me with extreme anxiety, and mood swings for lack of a better term can't engage in CBT surely there are other routes? Rather than to be left languishing. my mania has subsided as I have been put on medication by my GP, the psychiatrist once said because it didn't work in my early twenties that was a sign I wasn't bipolar? Well 4 years later it seems to be helping to a degree so why are they not reversing their logic?  
I write this whilst I can before I experience more of a dip in mood. I feel I have to write these thoughts before I go back under again.

readBy.name: North Ayrshire Health & Social Care Partnership
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: Flotte
title: My visit to the urology clinic
body: One member of staff was perfectly nice as one would hope and expect. Another I found to be hostile, dismissive and somewhat rude and abupt. They were the same in prior telephone consultation. After travelling 45 miles and not feeling well on the day, I was hoping to discuss my medical issues with the Urologist Instead, I really didn't expect to encounter this attitude and such hostility. I came away quite angry and shell shocked. Not used to such discourtesy. Another member of staff just mumbled and said nothing when I asked a question. Three staff. One very nice. One completely abrupt and rude. One who was just ignorant. I came in seeking help and advice, and the overall tone was there is the door. I have never had such reason or been driven to comment ever.. before today.

author: Lisa2103
title: Appointment experience
body:
I attended the hospital today for an MRI appointment had previously tried at my local hospital however was unable to do it so was referred to the GJH for the bariatric MRI upon attendance the receptionist was very welcoming and the HCA was also lovely and very professional. However, my experience after that changed. I felt very embarrassed about the way I was treated which left me quite upset.  
I know I’m a larger lady and that’s on me but to be treated like a second class human being caught staff making faces trying to position me which made me feel very embarrassed for a caring profession not so caring.  
I just wanted to share my experience as I feel when people get treated like this they hold back from seeking medical treatment. I know it’s really put me off. I don’t think I would go back. x

author: Big Sos
title: Experience parking at the hospital
body:
I was running late for an appointment at Crosshouse Hospital. I parked in the shade at the hospital. I noticed portacabin huts adjacent to the diabetic day centre. A staff member in a green NHS tee shirt with jeans approached me telling me to move my car and park it over there. I explained that I had my dogs in the car and I can only get shade here and therefore would not be moving my car. They then explained that this was a covid testing car park and that I was at risk of transmission. I explained that I was a fair distance from the testing centre, and the car park was empty. I also noticed members of the testing staff were sitting outside the portacabins not observing social distancing, and that the risk of transmission of covid-19 has increased with approaching me! I explained that I am late for an appontment and I must go. The staff member then took my car registration number and asked me for my name. I said it was none of their business. On exiting after my appointment Covid testing staff were still outside, not social distancing and the car park was still empty!  
This has left me feeling, stressed annoyed and frustrated. I felt that there was a lack of professionalism, poor communication skills and a lack of understanding.

author: 123p
title: Great patient experience
body:
Just wanted to give recognition to the rheumatology department at monklands. Specialist nurse Theresa went above and beyond to make sure my appointment went to plan and get me further support whilst I was in the department . Was very supportive when I had my little boy with me who is only one and was upset at times, I managed to get all my appointments seen that day bloods X-ray and quick consultation with my rheumatoid doctor to update meds in that one day instead of coming back for weeks of different appointments and having to bring baby with me so was very very helpful and helped a lot with my aniexty of lots of potential trips to hospital that would have been in next few weeks .  
Theresa and the team on shift that day were all very welcoming friendly and supportive.  
Thank you for a positive patient experience

author: Anneliese
title: Birth
body:
I was booked in for an elective section but started having contractions a few nights prior. I was in and out of the hospital to be checked over due to having had 2 previous sections and living 45 minutes from the hospital. All of the midwives were extremely professional, caring, kind and by the time I'd had the baby felt like friends. I was seen by a couple of doctors most of which made me feel at ease and responded to my concerns in a way that made me feel reassured although I felt with a couple that I was still a bit anxious after speaking with them.  
The surgery went well - the staff involved were excellent at calming my anxiety about the procedure and the anesthetist was exceptional at managing my blood pressure levels.  
I did have some adhesions which the surgeon alluded to during the procedure but I was a bit disappointed they did not come and visit afterwards to provide further detail as they normally come and go over how well the surgery went but I didn't see the surgeon again, and wanted to ask questions regarding this as I have been plagued with pain since my last section. I have struggled to gain understandable information about this since.  
In the hospital I was well cared for by all the midwife staff and felt welcome and not forced to rush home. I cannot remember everyone's name but I would like to especially thank Abbie, Suzie, Susan and Mariette for being so kind, attentive and interesting to talk with. The whole team were absolutely wonderful!

title: Supurb
body: My baby was admitted with breathing difficulties and feom start to finish the paediatric doctors and nurses were amazing. They were so caring and friendly, professional and knowledgeable. They really listened to us as parents and acted so fast when he was poorly to treat him. Such a kind warm and caring team, thankyou all from the bottom of our hearts.

readBy.name: Yeovil District Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent service
body: Always been available during pandemic. Doctor always called to speak to you. Reception staff very helpful and obliging.

title: No call back
body: My 3 year old was feverish and had a rash all over their body. When this got worse and spread to their face and eyelids I called 111 so as not to clog up the walk in centre unnecessarily. I was told to expect a call back in 2 hours, however  7 hours later I have heard nothing. I understand staff are under additional pressure at the moment but to not deal with young children is unacceptable and counter productive, as parents will simply go to A&E and cause additional pressure.

title: Refusing face to face appointment
body: Refusing face to face appointment(s) has led to having to go to A&E at Royal Stoke to receive clinical examination, care and reassurance. A&E keep saying your GP must see you and you must request a face to face appointment but no luck.  Really poor care for a pensioner.  Hope to try again tomorrow (for the 3rd time of asking) to see a GP, to be examined and hopefully a nurse to dress my legs (open wounds).  My daughter as to ring as I cant afford to be in a cue for 30mins on my mobile. Shocking care. Feel considerably let down!

title: Awful service
body: Accessed the walk in centre at the weekend following advice of pharmacist rather than use a and e which I didn’t think was appropriate for the problem I needed treating.  Nurse practitioner was rude and argumentative - exhibiting poor listening skills.   Judging by the volume of negative reviews left on google reviews about this service and people mentioning frequently a nurse with a bad attitude - I’m surprised that this poor service is continuing and hasn’t been addressed.

author: leatherxq53
title: Care in pregnancy
body:
I would like to thank all of the amazing staff at NHS Borders for the care I received during my two pregnancies. My boys James and Owen were born February 2020 and May 2021. With all the challenges of the pandemic I have struggled at times whilst pregnant with my mental and physical health. My last pregnancy and birth was not what I had expected, and I was not prepared for an emergency caesarean and my baby spending time in the neonatal unit. The kind caring and professional staff that have taken care of us on this journey will always have a special place in my heart and we can’t thank you enough.  
To the lovely staff in Special Care baby Unit. Nursing team, ANNP team and Paediatricians. Thank you for the outstanding care Owen received. You are an amazing team and it was so nice to see friendly faces and people I knew. Owen made a quick recovery and you helped me establish breast feeding. This enabled Owen to feed well once he was feeling better. I felt involved in my baby’s care throughout his admission and knew he was in the best hands even when I couldn’t be with him. I will always be grateful and thank you for caring for him when I couldn’t. I’m proud to be part of such a caring, compassionate and professional team. To the GP team at Coldstream Healthcentre and Doctor Morton, the physiotherapist staff Laura and Gillian and pharmacy team. Thank you for your care and continued support and advice. Midwifery team at Borders General Hospital. The continuity of care received from the Community Midwives really made a difference. Thank you so much for taking care of me and my boys. Labour ward midwives, Obstetric Doctors and theatre team. You all made me feel safe and cared for at a vulnerable time. The team in labour ward go above and beyond for the women and I feel privileged to have been looked after by you all. Ward 16 midwives and staff. The care you gave me after my caesarean was exceptional. I can’t thank you enough for your care and professionalism. The women of the Borders are so fortunate to have such great dedicated staff to look after them and their baby. Also thank you to The lovely domestic staff for always making sure my water bottle was full, thank you for your friendly chat and toast!

title: Fort knox
body: Why is this surgery refusing to let people book appointments at desk?  My husbands is able to go into his surgery.  I am on low income and cannot afford to blow my monthly mobile allowance on 1 phone call as it is taking 30 mins to get through. If this system is now permanent I will have to register elsewhere. No wonder people are dying if you can not get in the door for an appointment .

readBy.name: Lisson Grove and Woolwell Medical Centre

title: endocrine surgery
body: I would just like to commend the aftercare, I have received from my consultant surgeon and her team. The surgical procedure was successfully completed last year. I have since received the most exemplary follow-up outpatient treatment. I can highly recommend the unit, they are an absolute credit to the NHS.

readBy.name: Liverpool University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Ambulatory Emergency Care
body: Kind and considerate administration and nursing staff and female doctor but male doctor not communicative at all. Wouldn't put the guy I saw on the till in a shop let alone let him deal with vulnerable patients. Impatient, unengaged, not discussing treatment with me unless I queried something, used acronyms or other technical language to create a barrier and to reinforce the idea of his superiority, and felt less like I was getting care and more like if i wanted to know what was going on or querying my treatment I was just being awkward. I used to teach medical research and statistics to nursing students at the Wolfson Nursing School and to qualified doctors at the LSHTM. Would be proud for any of these nurses to have been my students. Doctor should probably either learn some basic patience and communication skills or find a research only role somewhere on the academic side where he doesn't have to deal with patients and patients don't have to suffer dealing with him.

title: Won't use again!
body: I call at 3.45 to explain my son is passing blood in his urine the call handler was great but waited for a clinician to call back. They called at 5.45 and stated I would get a GP call back within 3 hours. No call back so I called them and was told well you are unliky to get a call back before midnight. I told them on the phone this is ridiculous service. I told them if I was told this earlier I would have taken him to the hospital. I was trying to use this service to reduce the capacity in the hospital but ended up taking him anyway and turns out he has an infection. I could have got the antibiotics earlier when there was a pharmacy open. Now he has to wait another day before taking antibiotics because there no pharmacy is open. Oh then they call me after 2AM in the morning for me to tell them I have already taken him to the hospital!!!. I won't use this service again next time I will go straight to the hospital.

title: Fantastic staff
body: Had to visit A &E and then the DVT /GPAU dept everyone was so helpful I was there a long time but was given coffee and even sandwiches. Felt very safe and looked after.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: Reaction after covud vaccine
body:
We called 111 as my partner experienced swelling in his leg after the covid vaccine. We have a young baby so couldn't travel to the hospital last night. 

After being told a doctor would ring him within 6 hours, we were rung the next day to be told they had run out of time and we should ring our own gp now as they were closing. 

If this is or was a blood clot, he might have been dead by now. Totally let down, don't risk it, go private!

title: Exceptional Service
body: I wanted to send my personal thanks and highlight the exceptional, professional service I received from the entire team at Frimley Park Hospital A&E from the minute I entered the premise. I attended at 0845 20/06/21 and after two sets of X-Rays and two interactions with the senior Sister, I vacated at 1000. I can’t thank all from reception to radiology to the nursing staff enough. All staff were extremely welcoming and as I suffer acute anxiety they made me feel calm throughout. Please pass this on as I can’t compliment them enough. It’s important this is passed on because the basics are so often overlooked. Best regards.

title: They don’t answer the phone
body: Usually have to ring at least 80 times until I get through.. slow staff. Need more staff. Phone just cuts off

title: Very fast referral and treatment
body: Saw gp on monday with suspect  skin area on forehead  got an appointment offered on tuesday  saw doctor and consultant sunday, surgery to remove 2 areas os suspected skin cancer Wednesday. Really quick, friendly and professional.

title: poor surgary
body: been using the docs for many years but seems to have gone down the pan can never get an appointment docs are great but receptionist are not good and referrals are always late been soughted had to wait 6 weeks just for a letter and was told would only be a few days think i will be looking to move as i said good docs but run very badly

title: Covid Vaccination
body:
Had first jab, no problem.

Unable to book 2nd jab date, was told they'd be in touch.
After 10 weeks called and after holding for a couple of hours got through and was told no vaccine available, unable to say when.

Now 13 weeks after first jab, have booked elsewhere but still don't know if it will be the same AZ vaccine.

Pretty bad organisation & nothing like the excellent service my partner got at Whitely House surgery.

author: Tummy tantrums
title: Hysteroscopy at Lincoln Hospital
body:
I was absolutely petrified about having this procedure as I had read so many horror stories online about almost unbearable pain. It was not particularly pleasant, but certainly not unbearable for me. I will definitely give the biggest shout out and credit to Nicky, Heather and Ruth.  
From the moment I arrived, I was put at ease. Nicky explained what was going to happen in great detail and the team assured me that they would stop the procedure at any time if I wanted them to.  
Nicky carried out the procedure in the gentlest manner, explaining every step along the way. Heather and Ruth were holding my hands throughout. I am sure that her attention to detail, correct positioning on the couch, equipment used and her 'no rush' approach made all the difference.  
Nothing sinister was detected as far as she could tell, but a couple of polyps need removal. I will be booked in for polypectomy. Nicky will not be doing this, but has assured me that the consultant will be equally as gentle and kind as she was.  
I honestly feel hugely relieved as health anxiety can manifest and affect everything. I honestly could not function on the day of the hysteroscopy due to sickening worry. I was in tears at her kindness and reassurance. I cannot thank you enough.

title: Outstanding overall care
body: I would like to thank all of the maternity staff that supported me during my pregnancy and early labour. I have had my other two children in different hospitals and would have to say Royal London has been the best. I was treated so well and the hospital is clean and the rooms spacious. I had a high risk pregnancy and was looked after by the obstetricians and also the gateway team. Both ensured my anxiety was at bay and I felt confident and supported to have the birth I wanted. I was on ward 6E after having my baby and the staff were so caring towards myself and partner. Would highly recommend this hospital to have your baby. Thank you again for making my experience a positive one.

title: Caring practice
body: Always handle questions with care and always help if they can even in the difficult COVID situations.doctor acted very quickly with my husbands problem

title: Disappointed
body:
Disappointed at the lack of Care, Empathy, Consideration, Respect shown to elderly patients during their stay at the hospital.
A total disregard to an individuals need.
Letting down our elderly generation.

title: Compassionate care
body: I've struggled with my mental health throughout University and the GPs at Bournbrook Varsity have continually supported me throughout. They have always treated me with kindness, compassion and understanding which has definitely had a positive impact on my recovery. The receptionists have always managed to fit me in for a same day appointment when I've needed to speak to someone and the app is great for requesting repeat prescriptions and booking appointments. Thank you Bournbrook Varsity!

author: earmarkez59
title: Treatment over many months
body: Very well looked after. A brilliant service, without which life would have been very difficult.

title: A very good Practice. Protect the NHS
body:
Have had several medical health issues so I often need to speak to the reception. I have always found them to be very helpful and, if necessary, arrange for a doctor to call me which they invariably do. The doctor takes time to understand my problem and makes a referral to a consultant or NHS service as needed. If I require a repeat prescription I can do this using the practice web site. I have only praise for this practice.
I think people often forget how lucky we are to have such a great NHS and GP Practice who work with little resources to deliver such a service. If you don't like the NHS then it is the department of health that are in charge rather than the GP Practice who in my view provide excellent support often under pressure and difficult circumstances.

title: Impossible to get an appointment
body: I have phoned every day from 8:00 for 5 days to get an appointment for my daughter. After waiting for about an hour to get through I am told all appointments are gone, I really need to get my daughter seen by a doctor but don’t want to go to Ann’s E as it is not an emergency

author: Freefall
title: 5 star service
body: What wonderful cheerful staff looking after me.   I was the only overnight patient so had 5 star service after my prostatectomy.

author: LisaMcA
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Very happy with the treatment
body: Was very happy with the treatment I received, everyone was so kind.   would recommend Acute Care at Home to anyone and thank you very much for all that was done.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Happy Lad
title: My minor surgery today.
body:
I had tooth surgically removed in Forth Valley Hospital.  
Emma’s Team we’re fantastic. Alicia and Elizabeth were brilliant.

author: sunjb53
title: Angiogram
body: I wanted to thank Dr Ghattas and all the ward and theatre staff at Ayr Bruce Day Surgery Unit, for looking after me so well during my angiogram. Every one was so kind and so professional, that I knew I was in safe hands. I cannot praise them all enough.

author: Au7
title: No fuss
body: I had to have a blood test to ascertain whether I had contracted certain stds done with no fuss and without any sort of judgement or opinion being discernable

author: giftpm59
title: Missed Meds
body:
Son missed medication dose through no fault of his own. Remember its bank holiday weekend. Spent over 7 hours trying to sort something.  
Felt angry, frustrated, it seemed irrelevant that this was something that he could not go without, without the risk of him self medicating.  
Finally got help for him.  
Thanks to staff at CGL who we cannot thank enough in finding a solution to fix this mess!

author: perseushc67
title: Awful Maternity experience
body:
Russells Hall Hospital Maternity Unit June 2021. After speaking with a midwife about my feelings and mental health struggles with people I don't know and the fear of men I was told I was able to stay in a single room with my baby to recover until I went home. I stressed that for the past 12 months my issues with domestic violence with my ex partner and having to shield because of covid being repeatedly made aware to stay away from groups of people and to stay in my home because it could have an impact on my health if I were to get covid, gave me extreme social anxiety on top of already complexed mental health issues, to the point I never left my home or had contact with people apart from immediate family.  
I was moved anyway to a bay of 4 with other people and became distressed very quickly. I had no understanding from the lead midwife or other members of staff only judgement and humiliation. I felt I had to leave hospital before I was ready to in pain that I struggled to manage. Other patients were able to hear everything and made remarks to make me feel even worse. I overheard staff tell a lady in the next bed I was having a psychotic episode which was untrue as I was not in psychosis and had tutting from both of them. No one had any compassion to the distress I was in or to why. Not a single member of staff demonstrated any training on how to deal with someone who was in mental distress.  
I was made to carry my own bags and baby in a heavy car seat after having a c section no one offered to help or let my sister in to help me. This is a disgusting way to treat someone especially someone in crisis. This will be taken further by myself and family if no action is taken. I believe your staff need training and compassion.

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

author: Ellie S
title: Care of my dad
body: A big thank you to all of the staff who looked after my dad during his recent emergency surgery. To the A& E staff who saw him fist, the surgeon’s who did his operation and the ITU staff who looked after him! A final big thank you to Mr Pal for his handiwork: )

author: magpiefc77
title: Pregnancy & Birth
body: Excellent care from Aileen and the whole NHSGGC home birth team. The continuity of care was excellent; the team were warm, caring, understanding and nothing was ever too much bother. Outstanding service and hugely grateful to them for ensuring we successfully delivered both of my daughters safely and calmly at home.

author: elephantcw73
title: Stoma nurses
body: I would like to take the opportunity to publicly saying a big thank you to the stoma nurses in Shantallow. My life was turned upside down but the nurses have been fantastic helped me through the difficult times and now I can see light at the end of the tunnel

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Izzywizzy
title: Excellent care
body: Whilst on holiday my youngest daughter, Isabelle took poorly and after a call to 111 an ambulance took us to Scarborough hospital. Isabelle was struggling to breath and deteriorating quickly. The entire team that took care of Isabelle and myself were amazing. Being on my own while Isabelle was suffering a collapsed lung was terrifying. The staff who cared for us, in particularly Dr Mensah, all went the extra mile to make sure Isabelle got the care she needed and took the time to make sure I understood what was happening and gave me the support I needed to be strong for Isabelle. I can’t thank you enough for everything you did for us that night. Isabelle is now out of hospital and on the road to recovery.

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: EHT23
title: Good care in a difficult situation
body: I attended the Early Pregnancy Problems Clinic for assessment. I was met by approachable and reassuring Libby, (Nursing Support) and Judith (Senior Nurse) in EPPC. Judith was obviously very experienced in her specialty and her quiet confidence and professionalism immediately put me at ease. After Judith diagnosed me with an unexpected ectopic pregnancy, the care and compassion I received was exceptional. I had attended the appointment alone, but I certainly never felt alone or unsupported due to the care from all the staff and I’d like to mention Dr McClelland (Gynae) who formalised my diagnosis and set about efficiently taking action to manage my care and then taking time throughout her very busy day to make sure I was updated and informed about all aspects of my treatment (also giving some holistic self-care advice, thank you! )Dr Meek (Anaesthetics) who was a very reassuring, kind and empathetic presence when I very much needed it, Dr Glenn (Gynae Consultant) who’s explanations and reassurance provided me with confidence and trust in my medical care and finally to Gillian and Owen ( Gynae SHOs) for answering my questions and facilitating my discharge home quickly when the time came. To the anaesthetic nurse Jenny who kept me calm in Theatre and Katie in Recovery for keeping me pain free as I came around. The nursing care on Neely Ward was exceptional and I’d like to say a special thank you to Leah and Amy (Student Nurses), Lucy, Suzanne, Alice and Rebekah(Staff Nurses) and Meghan and Mary (Nursing Support) for all their nursing care and to all those I didn’t meet, I know you are numerous. Overall, the care I’ve received in EPPC, theatres and Neely ward under the care of the Gynae Team has been exceptional, making a difficult situation so much less stressful with their professionalism, skill and empathy. Thank you!

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: SolihullB
title: Waiting for a scan result
body:
I’ll keep this short and sweet, unlike my situation with the NHS…  
I had a virus which caused some back/upper leg pain. I suspected my body had overreacted and attacked my nerves in my upper leg as I had pins and needles 24/7.  
I went for a scan in my back and upper legs and was told a follow-up would be organised to discuss the results.  
Little did I know the results and the follow-up would be 18 months later!  
During this time I was buying my first house with my girlfriend. And as anyone knows, you need life insurance to get a mortgage. Unfortunately for me when several insurance providers looked at my medical records they could see that I have an outstanding health issue and need a discharge letter.  
3 months after the scan my leg and back was 100%. However, even after contacting Heartlands Hospital in Birmingham, they showed no empathy or understanding that I needed a discharge letter for my mortgage.  
Heartland hospital said that 18months is about the normal waiting time for the results and follow-up of a back scan.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

author: TonyH21
title: Booking another appointment
body:
I was supposed to get my second vaccine on Wednesday 16th June but was unable to attend but couldn't cancel either. I got through to Antrim but they gave me a phone number which didn't work.  
I eventually found this site and was wondering if I could ask how to book another appointment for the AstraZeneca vaccine. I apologize for not contacting sooner.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: ServiceUser14
title: Amazing midwives
body: I was in WGH ward 23 (labour ward) to have my baby boy this week and I cannot praise the midwives enough. Everyone was great from start to finish throughout triage, labour and anti-natal wards. I had an amazing midwife called Ann Marie and a student midwife Lucy who made my whole experience so much better. They were so attentive, patient and really went out their way to help in anyway they could. I am so thankful that they were part of my journey!

author: Surfsup
title: A&E visit
body:
I was seen very quickly by a number of different staff. All were really friendly and did a great job of putting me at ease. The setup felt very efficient.  
Overall it was an incredibly impressive demonstration of how professional, dedicated and caring our NHS workers are.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Falky
title: Out of Hours
body: During my holiday to Tiree I pulled /ripped a muscle chasing a dog and called NHS 24 to get this checked out. Both NHS 24 and the out of hours GP service were excellent and very helpful. I’m away home with crutches which I will get delivered back to   the Island.

title: More than happy.
body: I have been looked after by Port Isaac for two years. Every aspect of my care has been exemplary. The receptionists are friendly and helpful, same goes for the nurses and doctors. The pharmacy have never made a mistake and deliver my medication to a local shop. All this during a very challenging pandemic. Many thanks.

title: Great Service
body: Over the past months I have had a number of appointments both over the phone and in the surgery. I have a number of different health problems and all have been dealt with or are in the process of being dealt with. I have had physical examinations in the surgery along with blood tests and have been sent for X-Rays and an Endoscopy. I have been refereed to ENT. I am on a number of different medications for my health issues and have had no problems with my prescriptions. I have never had to wait overlong on the phone and reception staff are always friendly and helpful. The GPs and nurses I have seen are always very professional and helpful. The GPs have included me in making decisions about my treatment and are very person centred. The self referral form online is an excellent service too. I have never had a problem at all with the surgery and find everyone very caring and thoughtful. They all have a tough job to do and they do it very well
